column1: event,"

We have put down our deposit for the florist. We went with Floral Fixx which was recommended as the #1 choice from my wedding planner co-worker. Working with someone who has done wedding planning is definitely helpful.&nbsp
The flowers that will be used in my bouquet will be tiger lilies, roses, spotted orchids and a birds of paradise flower.
The bridesmaids will have only the roses and orchids.
The groomsmen, mothers, grandmothers, fathers, etc will all have combinations of the flowers as well.
Since leopard print is part of the theme I was hoping for spotted tiger lilies, but they apparently aren&#39
column3: s where the spotted orchids come in to give more of a leopard look to the bouquets.

column2: Quit my job today! It was so good. My boss flipped out because he's a fucking psycho. So, that was funny.

column1: I got a job with Rogers Radio in Winnipeg. Pumped."

event,"The ring is on the way.

Phil bought my engagement ring off eBay. Whatever if it's kinda lame I know it's coming, I don't know the exact date, time, place, etc the proposal will take place. Just what my ring will look like.
I started taking shifts at Boston Pizza again since I live closer to Winnipeg and money is nice.&nbsp

My car officially has been written off after weeks of MPI trying to make up their mind. Luckily I found a very similar car in yellow for only $400 more than what MPI is giving me for my old car. So I'm picking up the new beetle on Saturday. It has heated seats which make me happy, because heated seats rule.
It's a standard so I have to figure out how to drive it. I'll probably look like a tool for at least a week stalling my car. At least I don't live in the city and for the most part highway drive.

The money I'm using to buy the car is from money I had saved up to buy a boxer. I originally was told I was only getting $4600 for my car when they first told me it was written of, then they changed their mind and said it wasn't, then said it was again and are now giving me $5100. So, I have some extra money left over because I thought I would have to pay $900 for the new car I'm getting so I think I might go put a deposit down on a puppy that is ready to leave it's mommy in August.&nbsp

Other than the car issue life is pretty much cruising along as usual. Working two jobs is giving me hope of paying off and cancelling one of my credit cards (I have two). So, that should be down with soon.&nbsp
Then I'll find some other expense to put myself back in to debt with. Such as the huge list of things I want to do to the house.
I'm not really too concerned about being in debt, I pay my minimum payments so my credit rating isn't bad, and then one day I'll be dead and I won't have to pay back anyone. Whatever."

event,"We got our fence put in today. Very excting.. $2,300 for a basic chainlink fence. We wanted a wood one but it was estimated at $16,000. MAN! expensive. Oh well, we got the link fence in and now the dogs can run around without constant supervision.
I've been working out lots lately, bought the Jillian Michaels ""win by losing"" DVD box set. They're pretty crazy. I also have been doing the elliptical for about 20-30 minutes a day on top of that.
event,"I wonder why I don't have any friends?

I don't really have a best friend, or even any really tight friends. I have friends I've known forever and old work friends from boston pizza but I wouldn't call any of them my best friend. It came really clear once I moved who actually cared about me, which doesn't seem to be to many people. Friends I hung with multiple times a week while I lived in Winnipeg don't even attempt to contact me. I've tried to make plans with people and usually we do hang out if I'm coming in to the city but shouldn't a friend want to know whats going on and be in contact more than the occasional hang out that I usually arrange? I feel like I should just cut off all contact to these people, but then what? Try and make new friends? Luckily I've made friendships out of Phil's friends which is nice, but shouldn't I have my own friends? Is there a reason people don't like me?
Maybe it's my age group. I'm not a big bar star, I work a real job, own a house, etc. Most people I know my age only care about getting drunk and laid. Whatever.
I guess for now my crew consists of Phil, Andy, Bruno, Kiwi, Artemis and Mimi."

event,"Phil and I are moved in to the new house.  There's still lots of work that needs to be done, but nothing really mandatory. I really want to do vinyl siding especially on the front of the house to just make it look more even. It'll also help with insulation since it's was pretty cold when we first moved in so I don't want to think about what it'll be like in -50 weather.

The radio station is still not on air. I feel like they're not really working on this station too hard. It's like they keep opening new ones but don't bother to make the ones they already have any good.
We'll see how it goes I guess.

We have acquired another chinese crested named Andy. The plan was to give him to Phil's mom since she loves Bruno so much. They're totally different dogs though. Andy is much more in your face and high energy than Bru.
Phil's dad really likes him though, so they're going to take him for a test run and if all goes well they'll keep him.
We plan on getting a boxer eventually maybe later this year or next year. It'll be nice having a big dog. They're so different than little guys.

Phil got a job at the Viking in Gimli. He seems to be liking it, but we're back to not seeing each other that often any more since I work days and he works nights (was the other way around when I was bartending and he was working days.) But he's making good money and then we have time to miss each other so... it's all good.
He said that once he pays his mom back for his truck he's going to buy me an engagement ring. So, we may be getting married in a year or two.
It's crazy to think that I'm 21, own a house, live with the guy I'm most likely going to marry and work in the field I went to school for. It's pretty good.
I also live a 15 minute walk from the beach. I can't wait till it warms up so I can jump in the lake!
I'm trying to cut off 20lbs before summer. Obviously not gonna lose that much weight in such a short period of time but I'm working on it. Exercising daily and trying to eat a lot healthier."
event,"I don't ever want to move again.
Can't wait to see the house. Buying a house without even seeing it is weird... but I did it!

column2: Since I don't post very often, I probably should maybe that could be a new years resolution or something? But lots has happened over this year such as...

column1: +Started at The Academy of Broadcasting in January, graduated in October.
+Bought Bruno, my lovely hairless dog in March.
+Started my half sleeve and finished most of it, just have to add the inside piece which probably won't happen till maybe next summer? Spent $1,100 on it so far.
+Phil and I moved in together in June and moved to Swan River together in November.
+Got a radio job right out of school in Swan River, which is where I am now. Started November 1st.
- Gained about 15lbs while being in school. I plan on getting a gym membership again (which I canceled once I started school because I had no time to use it.)&nbsp
- Even though I'm happy about getting a job, living in a town with a population near 5,000 is weird and lonely. I'm very glad I have Phil with me.

- I miss serving and making tips. Even though my paycheque is larger (almost twice as much as my regular pay not including tips) than it was at Boston Pizza, I hate budgeting and I was so used to always having cash on me. I have to grow up I guess?
That's about all the big things that have happened to me during 2010. Bring it on 2011.&nbsp

My goal for 2011 is to save enough to put a down payment on a small house or condo but it all depends if I stay in Swan River that long or get a job somewhere else. The media business if full of moving."

column2: i think my cat and guinea pig are having a conversation."

column1: event,"So, school is starting to pick up. I've had 2 tests so far.. one I got 100% on and the other I did just this past friday so I'm not sure of my mark but I'm guessing it's not lower than 90%. I have ANOTHER&nbsp
column2: test on monday.. lots of work coming in now but it's alright I'm keeping up. It's not too hard.

column1: Also, I've been doing a few shows.. practicing out the radio feel a bit.
I'm on again this tuesday. It's pretty good, I've only screwed up a few times but it's all practice.

column2: I was doing some homework on my computer and now I don't think I'll ever fall asleep..

column1: waiting for CKUW to get back to me about doing a shoowww...&nbsp
I'll probably call them if they don't get back to me soon.

column2: I really need to get used to waking up early.&nbsp

column1: I SHOULD easily be able to fit gym time in before school yet somehow it's hard for me to wake up anytime before 11.

column2: Today I went to go buy some headphones for school with my dad. I have to get some decent quality ones that can work with audio equipment so we were looking around and I found some that looked like they'd do the trick for $40. My dad then finds some pink head phones for $80 and insists I get those ones instead basically just because they were pink. He was the one paying for them so I didn't really care if I'm going to get more expensive and pink headphones I'm in!&nbsp

column1: When we got back to my parent's place my mom asked how much they were and I said $80.&nbsp

My dad then butts in claiming he wasn't going to buy me some crappy ones. I thought it was really funny because really he didn't look at anything else about the headphones besides the fact that they were pink.
Schools still going good. Into week 2 of 36.&nbsp
I'm starting to think more like a radio host.. trying to think of how situations that happen through my day can be turned into a story to say on the radio.
I'm trying to get a hold of someone at CKUW to do a show on the university channel with my pal Katie who goes to U of W.&nbsp

They have a few openings and are apparently always happy to take on radio students because we actually know how to use the radio equipment and know how to put together a show better than some random university kid who wants to rant.
They have a show time open from 8-10pm on saturday night. I think it'd be fun to do some type of dance music &quot
column3: show.. all bar music requests.. etc. I'm trying to bust my ass these next few months so I can get an on air job right away.. ugh.. i don't want to have to do crap work once i'm done school lol.

column1: I'm really enjoying it so far and the homework has been nothing. I guess compared to having to study and do homework for university and labs it's nothing having a week to write a 3 page essay. I'm also certain that it won't be marked as hard compared to the way a prof would be marking it.&nbsp
Most of all I enjoy being on air.&nbsp

Brad (one of my teachers) let us go on air today and everyone was all scared. I got to go on during two breaks due to nobody wanting to talk. I think I'm going to start booking myself in for an hour at least once a week. Maybe even more. It's fun but also hard to always think of things to say and also not sound like you're on repeat or that you're a robot.&nbsp
Obviously practice will help and since I enjoy doing it I won't mind coming in early to go on.&nbsp

I originally went into this course thinking I'll try and go into TV but I think I might stick with the radio course. I have 8 weeks still to decide which side I'll specialize in but I kind of like sitting in a room talking to myself.. haha..."

column2: Today was my first day at Academy of Broadcasting..

column1: There's about 25 people in my class so it's nice and small and I'm sure that once we split to do specializing that the group that is heading towards TV broadcasting will probably be 10 or less. Seems that most people are radio focused. Meh, It'll be better for me I'm sure.&nbsp
Hopefully only 9 months and I'll be done with school, feels so much more motivating than the years I was planning to spend in university.&nbsp
+Went to the gym, staying on track
+Going to bed early, gonna catch up on some sleep
-Fought with my boyfriend over him vs my friends... so dumb."

column2: I'm back in school next week after a very short, 4 month break.&nbsp

column1: It went by too fast and I was way less productive during my break than I hoped to be.

I did buy a new laptop with the money I made during the break but didn't save enough for my trip so now I have to be super poor till I can afford to go away on spring break. It'll be worth it though.&nbsp
I also hope I can go to the gym as frequently as I have been once i'm back in school. I'm still not quite where I want to be fitness wise.
Since my last update I've moved to broadway. So far pretty good here.&nbsp
Minus the no parking and having to walk in the cold everywhere.&nbsp

column1: event,"I've been skipping school way to much and am falling behind. I&nbsp
column2: have so much stuff to do to try and catch up and it's soo stressful! I obviously did it to myself so I need to just suck it up and do my work. I hate winter. I'm glad it's starting to warm up, hopefully it actually keeps getting warmer instead of just dropping to -40 again :(

column1: It's so hard to get out of bed and go to school when you have a cold and it's super cold out! ugh.. life.
I need to find a way to be more motivated to go to school and to actually try hard. What to do!!
I also want to try and work out more, I'm thinking once I live nice and close to school next month it'll be easier since I'll also be close to the gym!
I get to go play with Mufasa on thursday. His eyes are open and he's walking around now! I&nbsp
column2: can't wait till I actually get to take him home."

column1: event,"I feel so tired lately. All I&nbsp
column2: want to do is sleep. I have no motivation for school right now which is pretty shitty. I hope once I move closer to school that I will actually go more often and on time! I have to do lots of studying to try and catch up but I just dont feel like it.

column1: I got an apartment downtown right by the university on young st. I'm going to be living in the ghetto! It's a 2 bedroom and it'll be just for me and the pets which is nice since the extra room will mainly be the pet room. I get my bengal in April. I went and picked him out on the weekend and put my deposit down on him. I can't wait till he's up and moving around so I&nbsp
That's really all for now, I'd love to go have a nap but I&nbsp
column2: have to go do some chem assignment :("

column4: I've been leaving my last project for school for the very last minute. I'm really bad for that but I'm also assuming most people are since everyone in my class I talk to also haven't started. I have started the abstract and that's about it. I guess it's better than nothing!
column7: I'm starting a breeding project soon with one male and two females. They have all reproduced before but not under my care. This will be my first breeding project so I hope everything goes well. I'm cross-breeding&nbsp
column8: 2 different types of snakes in order to get some &quot
column10: corns. The picture posted is what the babies should look like.&nbsp

column1: event,"I broke up with Eddie last night.
We've been fighting so much lately I&nbsp
column2: just couldn't take it anymore. It's really hard because I'm so tempted to just stay with him because it'd be so much easier. He promises things will get better and things will change but I've heard those words way to many times to believe anything will change or get better. I've never experienced a relationship where there was so much fighting. Nothing good can come from constant arguing.

column1: I have to figure out what's going on with the apartment. Tiffany is supposed to be moving in with me next month but I don't know where Eddie is going to go. He is making it seem like he needs me to live but I can't baby him and keep helping him with everything. He's 22 he needs to learn to take care of himself.

It sucks because I thought it'd be easier to do since I just felt so sure it was what I wanted and now I feel confused and hurt. I need to stick to my guns because there's no point in dragging on a failing relationship. Break ups are too hard."
event,"Yay, Eddie fixed my power cord! Computer is back up and running.
I got a job at Aardvark pets a few weeks ago and it's going good. I'm glad to be working with animals. The only problem is it makes me want moooree!!
I'm holding off for right now since the reptile expo is in a few weeks and I'm hoping to buy something there. I think last time they had some beardies for $20 so I&nbsp
column2: might grab one of those guys. I also want another snake. I'm thinking maybe a california king. One the breeders coming has some nice morphs. I'll see whats cheap and get something sweet. I'll post pictures of what I get :)"

column1: event,"My dog chewed through my laptop power cord and now I&nbsp

column1: I'm going to the cabin for the weekend for the first and only time for the summer and its poopey out :("

column2: I made an appointment for my tattoo today.&nbsp

column1: It seems like a lot of tattoo shops here have been going down hill.&nbsp
Not very many impressive artist from what I saw, and a few shops I just avoided due to hearing bad things about it.
I booked it at Living Canvas, her work looked really good and she's done lots of animals which is what I'm getting so I decided that'd be the place. My appointment is in October.
My power keeps going out, it went out for almost 2 hours. I can't imagine how people lived without power."

1. The guy who I went to before for my geese tattoo has now moved to a different shop. When I inquired about my new tattoo I was told I'd have to put down a $150 deposit which is high, but whatever it goes towards the tattoo, and then a $75 art fee which was me pretty much to pay him to just draw my tattoo. I want to get a small about 6"" tattoo of my dog and cartoon style now portait. That's so ridiculous! So I'm refusing to go to him due to the $75 art fee and now I have to go cruise around browsing profiles to find a new tattoo artist.

2. If the bus actually has a strike I either am going to have a moderatly long bike ride, plus downtown I think you can't bike on the sidewalk which scares me downtown all the cars, what not or I'd have to drive and pay for parking like&nbsp
column2: a sap. They better not strike, or be running again by the time I'm back in school or I'll be hella pissed."
I finally got all my school stuff figured out.&nbsp

column1: I only had 2 classes scheduled for the winter term because the biology course I planned on taking the labs all clashed with my other course, so I'll have to take a freakin' first year course in my 3rd year of university but whatever.. the first one didn't really count considering I only got 12credit hours.. so I'll be all done first year courses this term.&nbsp
I decided to get into an education course for the winter term since I plan on doing it anyways.&nbsp

Everything is all figured out and now only a few more weeks till it starts. I'm excited to start this year compared to last year since I'm more prepared for this year. I know what to expect now that I've already been through it and fucked a few classes up.&nbsp
The fail will always stare at me on my transcipt but I guess it's my motivation to do really good now since I have to get my GPA up even more so"

event,"

I hate the rain!! My one freakin' day off this week it has to rain.
The weather station also says its supposed to be nice for the rest of the week while I'm WORKING! I've gone to the beach ONCE this summer.. soo lame.

Only like 3 more weeks till school starts up again.
I need the money because I want to get another tattoo soon.&nbsp
I'm thinking of getting one of my dog, kiwi, on my leg.&nbsp
I wish my car was paid off.
It's nice having a nice car but it sucks having to pay almost $200 every two weeks for it.&nbsp
I can't wait till I'm done university and making decent money... but then I'll just have more expenses such as a house to pay for..&nbsp
I need to win the lottery."

column2: went to Alberta on the weekend.&nbsp

column1: I spent a lot of money, so I'm super broke now but it was worth it.
I was hoping to see more animals. There was mostly mountain goats strutting around on the road but that was pretty much it. We saw a bear running away but didn't get a picture of it.
West Edmonton mall is ridiculous. It's pretty much a city inside. There really isn't much you can't do in that mall, it has everything.&nbsp
event,"I think I'm going to start posting more often.
Basically since then I've gotten a boyfriend named Eddie. We've been dating since October.
We've moved in together in february.
We then began a small zoo in our apartment.
We have 7 snakes.. 3 corns (Bones, Noodles and Zuko), and 4 ball pythons (Homer, Marge, Terri and Sherri) a frog(pacman) and a pom-chi puppy (kiwi) who is more or less our child.
I work at west 49 still and recently got a job at tavern united.
I go to school at the u of w, majoring in chemistry
thats pretty much all thats new since my last post.
